item.title: Stocks to watch, January 16: Mastek, L&T Tech, Infosys, RVNL, RIL, Axis Bank, GAIL, LTIMindree, and more - Upstox
item.description:
Stocks to Watch on January 16: Key Companies and Earnings Updates

Publication Date: January 16, 2023
Source: Financial News

The domestic equity market is gearing up for a positive start, with key stocks like Reliance Industries, Axis Bank, and Infosys set to announce their Q3 results today.

  • Reliance Industries (RIL): Expected to report a mixed Q3 performance influenced by telecom and refining sectors.
  • Axis Bank: Anticipated to release its Q3 earnings today.
  • Infosys: Expected to show flat revenue growth with slight profit increases.
  • CEAT: Reported a significant decline in net profit due to high raw material costs.
  • RVNL: Secured a ₹3,622.14 crore contract from BSNL for BharatNet development and maintenance.
  • HDFC Life: Reported a 14% rise in net profit with a decline in total income.
  • GAIL: Settled a legal dispute with Gazprom's subsidiary for $285 million.
“While the rising raw material costs have impacted our margins, we progressively passed on part of the increase through price increases in select categories.” - Arnab Banerjee, MD & CEO, CEAT Ltd

Market participants are closely monitoring these updates for insights on financial health and future guidance, particularly in the context of ongoing economic challenges.

item.title: ITC Hotels Demerger: Sanjiv Puri's 1st comment on share listing, valuation and business expansion - ET Now
item.description:
ITC Hotels Demerger: Sanjiv Puri's 1st comment on share listing, valuation and business expansion

Updated Jan 16, 2025 - Source: ET NOW

ITC Chairman Sanjiv Puri has made his first comments regarding the demerger of ITC Hotels from the parent company, discussing the forthcoming listing of shares and expansion plans.

  • ITC Hotels shares will list on NSE and BSE within the next few weeks, with a target before mid-February 2025.
  • Sanjiv Puri emphasized that the market will determine the company's valuation post-demerger.
  • 125.11 crore equity shares have been allotted to eligible ITC shareholders as per the demerger scheme.
  • ITC Hotels plans to expand internationally, initially focusing on neighboring countries and West Asia.
“The role of management is to run the business well, make the businesses contemporary and future-ready, create value, and let the market determine the valuation.” - Sanjiv Puri

Sanjiv Puri highlighted that ITC currently operates 140 properties with plans for international growth while focusing initially on the proximate markets.

item.title: ITC chairman on 90-hour work week: We would rather like employees to ... - The Times of India
item.description:
ITC Chairman on 90-hour work week: We would rather like employees to ...

Publication Date: Not specified. Source: Not specified.

The ITC chairman expressed a preference for a balanced work environment rather than pushing employees into extreme 90-hour work weeks. Emphasizing the need for productivity without compromising employee well-being is becoming increasingly relevant in modern work culture.

  • The chairman advocates for sensible working hours instead of excessively long weeks.
  • Focus on employee well-being is highlighted as essential for productivity.
We believe in creating an environment that fosters a healthy work-life balance.

This perspective underlines the growing recognition among industry leaders of the importance of maintaining a healthy work environment for sustainable productivity.

item.title: US stock futures steady after Wall St rallies on soft CPI, strong bank earnings - Investing.com
item.description:
US Stock Futures Steady After Wall St Rallies on Soft CPI and Strong Bank Earnings

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Investing.com

U.S. stock index futures rose slightly as investors reacted to softer consumer inflation data and strong bank earnings on Wall Street.

  • U.S. stock futures experienced a slight increase following positive market movements.
  • Investors are optimistic due to a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas, reducing geopolitical tensions.
  • The market remains cautious ahead of the incoming President-elect Donald Trump's economic strategies.
  • Recent economic data showed a minor slowdown in inflation, possibly leading to interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.
  • Strong earnings reports from companies like JPMorgan, Wells Fargo, Goldman Sachs, and Citigroup boosted market confidence.
  • Positive performance of stocks, including a notable rise in U.S. shares of Brazilian airline Azul.
“Markets are still pricing in about two rate cuts this year, half of the four initially projected for the year.”

The stock market appears to show resilience amid mixed economic signals, with investors remaining watchful of political developments and upcoming economic data.

item.title: Hindenburg Research, which published report on Adani Group, to be disbanded: Founder - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Hindenburg Research Founder Announces Shutdown Amid Intense Work Pressure

Date: January 16, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Nathan Anderson, founder of Hindenburg Research, has announced the disbandment of his firm, citing the intense nature of the work as the primary reason. The firm has been instrumental in revealing significant corporate malpractices, impacting billionaire portfolios especially in connection with the Adani Group.

  • Anderson will wind up the firm after completing its last projects.
  • He emphasized the work's personal toll, stating it came at the expense of personal relationships.
  • Hindenburg's reports have prompted significant market losses for companies involved, including a reported $99 billion reduction in wealth for multiple financiers.
  • There will be a focus on creating educational materials regarding Hindenburg’s investigative methods.
“The intensity and focus has come at the cost of missing a lot of the rest of the world and the people I care about.” - Nathan Anderson

With Hindenburg Research coming to a close, Anderson plans to ensure his team's future placements while leaving a significant impact on corporate governance watchdog practices.

item.title: The Downfall of India’s Hot Startup Is Wiping Out US Debtholders - Bloomberg
item.description:
The Downfall of India’s Byju’s Is Wiping Out US Debtholders

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Bloomberg

On Wall Street, it was an easy sell: The most valuable startup in India’s history, a tech company with Silicon Valley cachet, a charismatic founder and visions of dominating the online-education business that seemed sure to be one of the post-pandemic’s next big things.

  • Byju’s was the most valuable startup in India.
  • The company had a strong reputation in the online education market.
  • There were significant investments from US debt holders.
“It was an easy sell.”

The downfall of Byju’s is impacting its US debtholders significantly, leading to concerns about the future of investments in Indian startups.

item.title: Natural Gas, WTI Oil, Brent Oil Forecasts – Oil Tests Multi-Month Highs As Crude Inventories Decline - FX Empire
item.description:
Natural Gas, WTI Oil, Brent Oil Forecasts – Oil Tests Multi-Month Highs As Crude Inventories Decline

Date: October 2023 | Source: FX Empire

The article discusses the recent trends in natural gas and oil prices, highlighting how crude inventories have been declining, leading to multi-month highs in prices.

  • Crude oil prices demonstrated upward movement due to decreasing inventories.
  • Natural gas prices experiencing fluctuations amid changing weather patterns.
  • Market analysts are predicting potential impacts on future pricing trends.
"As inventory levels drop, prices are poised to rise further, affecting market dynamics significantly."

The trends in crude inventories and their effect on pricing underscore the complexities of energy markets and the importance of monitoring these fluctuations.

item.title: IndusInd Bank, Kalyan Jewellers witness steepest fall in FPI ownership in 2024 - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Significant Decline in FPI Holdings for IndusInd Bank and Kalyan Jewellers in 2024

Publication Date: 2024
Source: CNBC TV18

The foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) have been cutting back on investments in Indian stocks due to worries about economic growth and stock valuations. In the December quarter, they withdrew $12 billion from the Indian market.

  • IndusInd Bank, Star Health, and Kalyan Jewellers saw the largest declines in FPI holdings.
  • IndusInd Bank's FPI ownership dropped from 42% to 24.7% year-on-year.
  • Other banks like Kotak Mahindra and Axis Bank experienced a fall of 7.3 percentage points in FPI ownership.
  • The FPI holding in HDFC Bank decreased from 52.3% to 49.2% year-on-year.
  • Major companies with significant declines include Zomato (7.6 ppts) and Delhivery (8.9 ppts).
"FPI selling is related to rise in the dollar as investors gear up for higher US inflation," said Atul Suri, CEO of Marathon Trends-PMS.

Despite FPI selling pressures, there is optimism about sustained vitality in the equity market impacting the financial services and IT sectors going forward.

item.title: OPEC Projects Robust Oil Demand Growth For 2025 And 2026 - OilPrice.com
item.description:
OPEC Projects Robust Oil Demand Growth For 2025 And 2026

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Oilprice.com

The Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) released its Monthly Oil Market Report, forecasting a significant increase in global oil demand, primarily driven by non-OECD growth.

  • OPEC forecasts global oil demand growth at 1.4 mb/d in 2025 and 2026.
  • Non-OECD demand is expected to grow by 1.3 mb/d, while OECD countries see minimal growth of 0.1 mb/d.
  • Non-DoC liquids supply is also set to increase by 1.1 mb/d, mainly from the U.S., Brazil, Canada, and Norway.
“The Declaration of Cooperation (DoC) is a loosely coupled organization that started in 2016.”

OPEC emphasizes the importance of non-OECD countries in driving future oil demand, pointing to stabilizing efforts in the global oil market.

item.title: Wall Street today: US stocks climb after inflation data, robust bank earnings | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
US Stocks Climb After Inflation Data, Robust Bank Earnings

Publication Date: January 15, 2025, Source: Live Mint

US stocks experienced a significant increase on Wednesday due to positive inflation data that heightened investor optimism for potential interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve, alongside strong quarterly results from leading US banks.

  • The Dow Jones Industrial Average increased by 613.51 points, or 1.44%, reaching 43,131.79.
  • The S&P 500 gained 85.16 points, or 1.46%, to settle at 5,928.07.
  • The Nasdaq Composite rose by 335.07 points, or 1.76%, to 19,379.64.
  • The Labor Department reported a 2.9% rise in the Consumer Price Index (CPI) on an annual basis for December 2024.
  • Bank stocks, including JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs, saw notable gains following their profit reports.
  • Gold prices rose alongside a dip in the US dollar after the inflation announcement.
“The latest inflation data strengthens the case that the Federal Reserve's interest rate cutting cycle is not over yet.”

In conclusion, the combination of optimistic inflation data and robust banking sector performance has buoyed market confidence, influencing both stock and gold prices positively.

item.title: Amul takes cheeky jab at L&T chairman's 90-hour remark with doodle: 'Labour and Toil?' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Amul takes cheeky jab at L&T chairman's 90-hour remark with doodle: 'Labour and Toil?'

Date: January 15, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Dairy brand Amul reacted to the 90-hour workweek controversy initiated by L&T chairman Subrahmanyan, sharing a playful doodle that chimed in on the debate. The company took a light-hearted jab with the caption 'Labour and Toil? Amul stares at bread daily.'

  • Amul joined the conversation after L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan suggested a demanding 90-hour workweek.
  • Subrahmanyan's comments sparked widespread social media backlash and reactions from various corporate leaders and public figures.
  • L&T defended the chairman's remarks, citing a 'larger ambition' for India and the need for extraordinary effort for progress.
  • The International Labour Organisation notes that India has high rates of prolonged working hours, with many working over 49 hours a week.
“What do you do sitting at home? How long can you stare at your wife? How long can the wives stare at their husbands? Get to the office and start working,” said Subrahmanyan.

The conversation around work hours continues to stir debate in India, particularly as companies like L&T push for more extreme work expectations amidst a workforce that's already among the most overworked globally.

item.title: US Dollar Index avoids meltdown after traders got all excited over marginally softer CPI release - FXStreet
item.description:
US Dollar Index avoids meltdown after traders got all excited over marginally softer CPI release

Publication Date: January 2025

Source: FXStreet

The US Dollar Index (DXY) has shown signs of volatility following the release of December's Consumer Price Index (CPI), which came in slightly softer than expected, leading to a momentary surge in risk-on sentiment among traders.

  • The US Dollar faces a near 1% loss for the week.
  • The December CPI release did not significantly surprise the market but is perceived as disinflationary.
  • The DXY has dropped below the 109.00 level, seeking support.
  • Equities have rallied over 1% in both Europe and the US after the CPI announcement.
"Expectations are for the Federal Reserve (Fed) to remain data-dependent with uncertainties that could influence the inflation path once President-elect Donald Trump takes office on January 20."

In conclusion, while the CPI data has provided some temporary relief to the dollar, the DXY remains under scrutiny as traders anticipate further guidance from Federal Reserve officials.

item.title: RBI to conduct daily VRR auctions from Friday to infuse liquidity - Business Standard
item.description:
RBI to Conduct Daily VRR Auctions to Improve Banking Liquidity

Date: October 2023 Source: Reserve Bank of India

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is set to conduct daily variable rate repo (VRR) auctions on all working days to address liquidity issues in the banking system, starting Friday with an amount of Rs 50,000 crore.

  • The liquidity deficit in the banking system has surpassed Rs 2 trillion recently.
  • The RBI's new approach aims to alleviate current liquidity constraints ahead of GST outflows later this month.
  • The auctions will occur daily, except for Fridays when reversals will be on the following Monday or the next working day.
  • Participants are expected to bid higher due to current market conditions, reflecting a slight increase in borrowing costs.
  • The RBI will adjust auction amounts based on ongoing liquidity assessments, announcing specifics on its official website.
“Given the current liquidity conditions, participants are likely to bid at the higher end of the band, which means borrowing will come at a slightly higher cost.” - Anshul Chandak, head of treasury at RBL Bank.

This initiative aims to assure stable liquidity within the banking system, with experts suggesting that further fiscal measures may be needed to address enduring liquidity concerns.

item.title: Carried by SpaceX rockets, Bengaluru firm's ‘Fireflies’ make India's first private satellite constellation - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Carried by SpaceX rockets, Bengaluru firm's ‘Fireflies’ make India's first private satellite constellation

Date: Jan 15, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Two Indian startups, Pixxel and Digantara, have successfully launched their satellites via SpaceX rockets, marking a new milestone in India's private space sector.

  • Pixxel becomes the first private company in India to establish a constellation of satellites with advanced hyperspectral imaging capabilities.
  • Digantara launches the world's first commercial satellite for tracking objects in space.
  • Pixxel's satellites offer a resolution six times better than traditional systems, allowing observations across over 150 bands.
  • Both companies highlight the importance of space surveillance for safety in an increasingly crowded orbit.
“For the first time a 5 meter hyperspectral is available. That is what makes it unique, not just in India, but globally.” - Awais Ahmed, Pixxel co-founder and CEO

This launch signifies a major leap for India's private sector in space, promising advancements in earth observation and space safety.
